intro: Tupa flavescens, commonly known as the yellow tupa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
